One of its components is the breadcrumb, which helps users navigate through a website's hierarchy. By default, Bootstrap provides a basic breadcrumb style. However, it is possible to customize the breadcrumb styles to match the design of your website. This documentation will guide you through the process of customizing the breadcrumb styles in Bootstrap 5.3. ### Objective and Scope The objective of this documentation is to provide step-by-step instructions on how to customize the breadcrumb styles in Bootstrap 5.3. The scope of this documentation includes the necessary requirements, pre-requisites, and best practices for achieving the desired custom styles. ### Requirements and Pre-requisites To follow along with this documentation, you will need the following: - Basic knowledge of HTML and CSS - Bootstrap 5.3 installed in your project ### Step-by-Step Instructions 1. By following the step-by-step instructions provided in this documentation, you can easily create a custom breadcrumb navigation that suits your needs. Remember to consider best practices and recommendations to ensure optimal performance and usability.
